CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1941, pg. 3 reads: "Pittsburgh Coal Company Employees Jam Rock Springs Park During Annual Picnic - Thousands of employees of the Pittsburgh Coal Company jammed the facilities at Rock Springs last week when the annual company picnic was held there. Although many had to travel some distance to get to the park, this was no determent judging by the crowd and the amount of money that was reportedly spent during the day.  many cities and towns in Pennsylvania, Ohio, and West Virginia were represented.  Boating, swimming, dancing, in addition to the usual park activities were engaged in by the throngs as well as eating.  Many of the concessions were sold out of hot dogs...A view of the busy ferris wheel may be seen in middle... Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Ferris wheel and Cyclone roller coaster at Rock Springs Park, Chester, West Virginia
